user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of parse_bauth_params:
```c
static bool
parse_bauth_params (const char *str,
                    size_t str_len,
                    struct MHD_RqBAuth *pbauth)
{
  size_t i;

  i = 0;

  /* Skip all whitespaces at start */
  while (i < str_len && (' ' == str[i] || '\t' == str[i]))
    i++;

  if (str_len > i)
  {
    size_t token68_start;
    size_t token68_len;

    /* 'i' points to the first non-whitespace char after scheme token */
    token68_start = i;
    /* Find end of the token. Token cannot contain whitespace. */
    while (i < str_len && ' ' != str[i] && '\t' != str[i])
    {
      if (0 == str[i])
        return false;  /* Binary zero is not allowed */
      if ((',' == str[i]) || (';' == str[i]))
        return false;  /* Only single token68 is allowed */
      i++;
    }
    token68_len = i - token68_start;
    mhd_assert (0 != token68_len);

    /* Skip all whitespaces */
    while (i < str_len && (' ' == str[i] || '\t' == str[i]))
      i++;
    /* Check whether any garbage is present at the end of the string */
    if (str_len != i)
      return false;
    else
    {
      /* No more data in the string, only single token68. */
      pbauth->token68.str = str + token68_start;
      pbauth->token68.len = token68_len;
    }
  }
  return true;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: Rule 17.8 prohibits modifying function parameter variables (the pointer itself), but allows modifying the object referred to by a pointer parameter. In this function there are no assignments to the parameter variables 'str' or 'pbauth' (no occurrences like 'str = ...' or 'pbauth = ...'). The only writes are to members of the object pointed to by pbauth (pbauth->token68.str and pbauth->token68.len), which is permitted by the rule. The 'str' parameter is declared const and is only read (str[i]), so it is not modified. Therefore there are no fragments that need investigation for potential violation of MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8.
